entry.title: Game: Mega Man 9 (PS3, 2008)
entry.content:
Game: Mega Man 9 (PS3, 2008)20160102
I played about four continues of this. I used one and a half to
beat Galaxy Man and then the rest to fail against Jewel Man. I
found his level very hard... I kept dying on the swinging
platforms and then against the rock boss. I got to him one time
but couldn't get the Black Hole Bomb to hit and just died. It was
very frustrating.

entry.title: Game: Tokyo Jungle (PS3, 2012)
entry.content:
Game: Tokyo Jungle (PS3, 2012)20160102
I played through the tutorial and then as the Pomerian for a
while. I messed up by going too far in the southern direction and
then messed up again by trying to attack a tiger and getting
killed by it. I thought that the "Clean Kill" would instantly kill
what I attacked, but it just does a lot of damage. This game is
totally insane. I love it.

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (10)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (10)20160101
I finished the game today. I really did not like the end game at
all. I was very annoyed that they took away Machine and Rem, who I
had put a ton of effort into improving. Even worse, they didn't
put their accessories back into my inventory, so I lost my most
powerful accessories and couldn't use them with the other
characters. I managed to get to the Chapel of Destruction and do
two of the rooms before everyone died. I was going to give up or
try using a Phoenix Down, but Cid revived everyone and I stomped
through the end. I was also annoyed that the end game made me do
the special challenges and gave no indication of what was going to
be expected; for instance, I went in to the room with the "Use
only magic attacks" with a party that had no magic users, had to
get them killed, and then barely scraped by with three characters
that had access to magic. It was lame. The final story beats were
really confusing and weird. It was a little beautiful and nice how
chummy the Class Zero students were, but I was let down overall
with the story.

I feel like the gameplay was very good, but there were lots of
messy things about the game that pulled down my enjoyment of it.

Total time: 25:00
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy Type-0 HD
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens, directed by J. J. Abrams (2015) (3)
entry.content:
Movie: Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens, directed by J. J. Abrams (2015) (3)20160101
I saw this again with my brother, this time in 2D.

I enjoyed it a lot again. I noticed Daniel Craig's voice. I noticed
the characters acknowledge how it was like A New Hope by saying
that Starkiller Base was "like the Death Star" (and they make a
joke about how much bigger it is.) I noticed more that Kylo Ren
seemed to know something about Rey because when he heard that "a
girl" had got off the planet, he was very made. I was surprised
that in the fight between Kylo and Rey she didn't cut off his
hand... at one point it looked like she did.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (9)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (9)20151231
I played up to the beginning of Chapter 8. There were some good
fights in there, which was great. The story is insane now and I
have no idea what's going on. I noticed some scenes with really
bad voice acting and really bad writing (or maybe translation.)
The katana guy is really bad and General Qator used the uncommon
word "reprisal" like eight times in a row and it was very awkward.

Total time: 22:27

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4, 2015) (8)20151230
After leaving it running for several nights and most of a day, I
farmed enough SPP to unlock the SP Crystal. I had Rem as the
active character, so now she is super powerful as well. It's
pretty rad. I continued doing missions and got to
Chapter 7. Walking around across the world to do everything is
very painful. I'm trying to get the airship, which exacerbates the
problem because you've got to cover a lot of ground to get to the
Expert Trials related to it.

The missions between Chapters 5 and 7 were really awesome. I
didn't understand what it meant when I divided up my group, so I
stupidly didn't include some of my favorite and valuable
characters in the group that I actually had to control and use. I
managed, however. Then in the next part, it was funny to not be
able to use Rem because she is so powerful for me, although
clearly the reason why was the story. I beat Gilgamesh on the
Bridge, although I got the feeling he was supposed to win.

Total time: 19:44
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy Type-0 HD
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens, directed by J. J. Abrams (2015) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens, directed by J. J. Abrams (2015) (2)20151230
Now that I've seen the movie, I'm going a deep dive of reading
about theories, spoilers, etc to see things I missed.

Tyler Cowen's opinions on Finn's race are interesting:
http://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2015/12/race-in-star-wars-the-force-awakens.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+marginalrevolution%2Ffeed+%28Marginal+Revolution%29
I was struck by the idea of Finn being a slave and in particular
one that was raised to deal with sanitation, etc.

It's awesome that Daniel Craig was a Stormtrooper:
http://www.polygon.com/2015/12/18/10577472/a-pretty-big-cameo-in-star-wars-the-force-awakens-revealed
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Dragon Ball Z - Season 2 - Episode 38 - A Collision Course
entry.content:
Dragon Ball Z - Season 2 - Episode 38 - A Collision Course20151230
I like the plan of keeping the Dragon Balls away from each
group. I assume that this delaying tactic will work, as Vegeta
and Frieza are probably evenly matched, then Goku will show up
and settle things. Either that or Frieza really is stronger than
Vegeta, the two will fight, and Goku will come and fight Frieza
(we've already seen him fight Goku, so that would be boring.)
  • TV Shows
  • Dragon Ball Z

entry.title: Movie: Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens, directed by J. J. Abrams (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens, directed by J. J. Abrams (2015)20151229
(As with all my comments, this contains no regard for spoilers.)

I thought this movie was so awesome. I was almost giddy as the
title scroll opened and I was watching a new Star Wars movie. The
movie felt so nostalgic and similar to the first trilogy in the
wonder and openness of the story, as opposed to the prequels which
felt very stuck in one place and like they were just by-rote
arriving at a known conclusion.

The new characters are very interesting and fun. Finn is very cute
as an idea and Rey is awesome. I really liked it when Finn was
like, "We'll use the force" and Han is like, "That's not how it
works." Good moment. Kylo Ren was a great villain and his Force
powers are really cool. I really like the mystery and implications
of the interleaving years, with Luke having tried to start a new
Jedi order and failed, first on his own nephew. I think the First
Order were very sinister villains and I wonder if they can possibly
recover from this hit or if the next movie's villainy will be
focused just on the "Supreme Leader" character.

Questions...
- Who was the old guy in the beginning that knew Kylo?
- Why is his name Kylo Ren and not "Darth" Ren or something like
that, is he not a Sith?
- Finn says he was taken as a child... how does that work? It's
very funny how he was not even an important Stormtrooper.
- How and why did Kylo turn to the Dark Side? I thought it was so
cool and iconic that he was idolizing Vader.
- Who are Rey's parents? She clearly seems like a
Skywalker---strong Force, great pilot, great with machines---but
she can't be Leia's child or all the characters involved, Leia,
Han, and Kylo would have said something. Is she Luke's? But then
who is the mother and why would he leave her? To protect her from
him or others? Seems like a very bad life to leave her in. I
suppose if he left her with Leia she'd be a target for Kylo as
clearly a Skywalker. I really want to watch her vision again.
- Who is this Supreme Leader guy, Snokes?
- What will Luke say to Rey? He looked great and I'm amazed that he
had no lines at all.

I like it and think that it is necessary for Han to have died to
pave the way for new heroes and close the book on his group's
adventures. It also makes a nice echo for the similarities between
this movie and the first, as the mentor ("Father I've never had")
is killed at the end in a light-saber duel. They even included a
cantina and a similar moment about the Kessel Run (that was a great
nod!)

I feel like Finn could become a Jedi, except that it goes against
the similarities to the previous trilogy and distracts from the
emphasis on the Skywalker family. I find it very believable that
people would not remember the Jedi, because even when Luke was
young it had been 20 years since they were around and it's not like
Luke was really that famous either, so we're 50 years (a generation
and a half) from the Republic and the height of lots of Jedi.

As a final note, I watched it in 3D and thought it was very
good. It was the first movie I ever saw in 3D, so I was nervous
about it being gimmicky or hard to follow, but I enjoyed it and had
no objection.

It is very fascinating to be able to wonder and ask these
questions.
  • Movies
  • 2015
